intro: Arethusa tetrapetala, commonly known as the four-petaled arethusa, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in wet, acidic soils, often in swampy or boggy habitats. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Arethusa tetrapetala is an important species for ecological studies due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements.
